section.title: Replacing a Swift Node
section.para: Maintenance steps for replacing a failed Swift node in your environment.
This process is used when you want to replace a failed Swift node in your cloud.

warning.para: If it applies to the server, do not skip step 10. If you do, the system will overwrite the existing rings with new rings. This will not cause data loss, but, potentially, will move most objects in your system to new locations and may make data unavailable until the replication process has completed.

section.title: How to replace a Swift node in your environment

listitem.para: Update your cloud configuration with the details of your replacement Swift node.
Edit your servers.yml file to include the details (MAC address, IPMI user, password, and IP address (IPME) if these have changed) about your replacement Swift node.

note.para: Do not change the server's IP address (that is, ip-addr).

listitem.para: Example showing the fields to edit, in bold:
listitem.screen: - id: swobj5 role: SWOBJ-ROLE server-group: rack2 mac-addr: 8c:dc:d4:b5:cb:bd nic-mapping: HP-DL360-6PORT ip-addr: 10.243.131.10 ilo-ip: 10.1.12.88 ilo-user: iLOuser ilo-password: iLOpass ...
cd ~/openstack git commit -a -m "replacing a Swift node"

listitem.para: Update Cobbler and reimage your replacement Swift node:
Obtain the name in Cobbler for your node you wish to remove. You will use this value to replace <node name> in future steps.
Remove the replaced Swift node from Cobbler:
Re-run the cobbler-deploy.yml playbook to add the replaced node:
Reimage the node using this playbook:
listitem.screen: cd ~/openstack/ardana/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost bm-reimage.yml -e nodelist=<node name>

listitem.para: Complete the deployment of your replacement Swift node.
Obtain the hostname for your new Swift node. You will use this value to replace <hostname> in future steps.
Configure the operating system on your replacement Swift node:

If this is the Swift ring builder server, restore the Swift ring builder files to the /etc/swiftlm/CLOUD-NAME/CONTROL-PLANE-NAME/builder_dir directory. For more information and instructions, see and .
Configure services on the node using the ardana-deploy.yml playbook. If you have used an encryption password when running the configuration processor, include the --ask-vault-pass argument.
